targets.query: SELECT mean("from_srvr_rtt")+mean("to_srvr_rtt") FROM "persecond" WHERE ("flow_g" =~ /^$flow_g$/ AND "dp_type" = 'eps' AND "m_type" = 'flow' AND "from_srvr_rtt" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "server"
SELECT mean("rtt_server_s")+ mean("rtt_client_s") FROM "tcp_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_ip"

panels.description: Session Round Trip Time: The average transit time for packets travelling from the cVu to the server, back to the cVu, to the client and then returning back to the cVu.

styles.linkTooltip: Click to drill down to current server

targets.query: SELECT mean("from_srvr_rtt")+mean("to_srvr_rtt") as "Avg" FROM "persecond" WHERE ("flow_g" =~ /^$flow_g$/ AND "m_type" = 'flow' AND "dp_type" = 'eps' AND "from_srvr_rtt" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "server"
SELECT mean("rtt_server_s")+ mean("rtt_client_s") FROM "tcp_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_ip"

panels.title: Session RTT for "$flow_g"

panels.description: Session Round Trip Time (to server and back, to client and back) for Server $server

targets.query: SELECT mean("from_srvr_rtt")+mean("to_srvr_rtt") FROM "persecond" WHERE ("flow_g" =~ /^$flow_g$/ AND "m_type" = 'flow' AND "dp_type" = 'eps' AND "from_srvr_rtt" > 0 AND "server" =~ /^$server$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($res), "server", "client" fill(none)
SELECT mean("rtt_server_s")+ mean("rtt_client_s") FROM "tcp_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/ and server_ip =~ /$server/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_ip"

panels.title: Session RTT ($server Sessions)

targets.query: SELECT mean("rtt_server_s") FROM "tcp_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_ip"

panels.description: Round Trip Time from the cVu to the server and back to the cVu.

targets.query: SELECT mean("rtt_server_s") FROM "tcp_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY  "server_ip"

panels.title: Server Side RTT for "$flow_g"

panels.description: Round Trip Time (to server and back) for Server $server

targets.query: SELECT max("from_srvr_rtt") AS "from-server", max("to_srvr_rtt") AS "to-server" FROM "persecond" WHERE ("flow_g" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($res) fill(0)
SELECT mean("rtt_server_s") FROM "tcp_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/ and server_ip =~ /$server/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "server_ip", "client_ip"

panels.title: Server Side RTT ($server Sessions)

targets.query: SELECT mean("response_time_s_avg") FROM "tcp_active_sessions_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($res), "server_ip"

panels.description: The server SYN to SYNACK Response Time.

targets.query: SELECT mean("response_time") FROM "persecond" WHERE ("m_type" = 'flow' AND "dp_type" = 'eps' AND "flow_g" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($time_range*2), "server", "client" fill(none)
SELECT mean("response_time_s_avg") FROM "tcp_active_sessions_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($res), "server_ip"

panels.title: Response Time for "$flow_g"

panels.description: The server (SYN to SYNACK) response time for server $server

targets.query: SELECT max("from_srvr_rtt") AS "from-server", max("to_srvr_rtt") AS "to-server" FROM "persecond" WHERE ("flow_g" =~ /^$flow_g$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($res) fill(0)

SELECT mean("response_time_s_avg") FROM "tcp_active_sessions_4_tuple" WHERE ("network_monitor_name" =~ /^$flow_g$/ and server_ip =~ /$server/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($res), "server_ip", "client_ip"

panels.title: Response Time ($server Sessions)

panels.content:
#### Usage Notes:
- The panels are filterd by the selected Network Monitor: $flow_g
- When following links, the Network Monitor selection ($flow_g) will also be applied to the Linked Dashboard
- When following links, the Server selected in the pull down menu ($server) will be passed to the Linked Dashboard
- User Defined Filters on indicators: Adds dashboard filters to narrow down the view (the Linked Dashboard may also be affected)
- If you don't want the "User Defined Filters" to apply to Linked Dashboards, then clear these filters before clicking a link.
panels.title: Latency for Network Monitor "$flow_g"
Instructions: How to Use This Dashbaord

list.label: Server
list.name: server
list.query: show tag values with key =~ /server_ip|server|client_ip/ limit 100

title: Latency Network Monitor Level 2 w Sapphire
